ygData.subject: Re: In position...
ygData.msgSnippet: Tyrael: Either we can trust him or you ll be his personal executionner if he betrays us. For now though, he s still in my good graces.

Tyrael: Either we can trust him or you'll be his personal executionner
if he betrays us. For now though, he's still in my good graces.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> Synergy::
> 
> The Guardian's massive size forces her to hunt around for a dry area 
> to land in, so her weight won't trap her in the mud.  Once there, she 
> transfroms to tank mode, then makes the quasi-transformation from 
> mobile tank to stationary artillery piece.  Her rangefinder draws a 
> bead on the predacon shields - she can hit them from here, albeit 
> inaccurately, but that's not the point.  What concerns her is that 
> the shields are still up to be hit.
> 
> "Tyreal," she says through the comm, "are you sure this Deathsteel 
> character can be trusted?  Those shields aren't going anywhere."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> > : : Darkangel : :
> > 
> > Following the orders, Darkangel flies low into the swamp area, 
> conceling himself.
> > 
> > 
> > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > The large fiendish flyer silently landed on top of a wet pile of 
> wood
> > in the marshes to the south of the Predacon base. She looked around
> > and saw no signs of sensor outposts. She was well out of the sensor
> > area, but it was no reason to be uncautious.
> > 
> > Dreadplague: Dread to attack force. No sign of sensors in grid
> > upsilon. Any news from Deathsteel?
> > 
> > The luminescent blue phoenix focused his concentration as to make 
> his
> > glow under control. He plunged under the tree canopy and stopped
> > completely.
> > 
> > Tyrael: Not yet. We wait for now until I give the order. To 
> everyone,
> > hide in the swamps and lie there.
> > 
> >
